revised_title: Anatomical Analysis of the Brain and Skull of Amphioxus lanceolatus
tldr: The author examines the brain and skull of Amphioxus lanceolatus, a unique member of the Vertebrate series, and finds that it possesses well-defined divisions of the cerebro-spinal nervous axis and spinal column, which are similar to the encephalon and cranium of higher Vertebrates. This suggests that Amphioxus may be an important model for understanding the evolution and development of the vertebrate skull and brain.
